text: Charles O'Hagan (28 July 1881 – 1 July 1931) was an Irish professional association football forward and manager. He was the first Aberdeen player to be capped at international level for Ireland. O'Hagan was Norwich City's sixth manager, and was in charge for 21 matches between 1920 and 1921. His sides won 4, lost 8 and drew 9 games. == References == ==External links== * *Sevilla CF profile *Charlie O'Hagen (Wild Geese Blog) Category:Norwich City F.C. managers Category:Sevilla FC managers Category:1881 births Category:1931 deaths Category:People from Buncrana Category:Aberdeen F.C. players Category:Everton F.C. players Category:Tottenham Hotspur F.C. players Category:Greenock Morton F.C. players Category:Third Lanark A.C. players Category:Middlesbrough F.C. players Category:English Football League players Category:Scottish Football League players Category:Pre-1950 IFA international footballers Category:Irish association footballers (before 1923) Category:Association footballers from County Donegal Category:Association football inside forwards Category:Expatriate football managers in Spain Category:Republic of Ireland expatriate football managers Category:Irish expatriate sportspeople in Spain Category:Irish expatriate sportspeople in Scotland Category:Irish expatriate sportspeople in England
